Package it.polimi.ingsw.model.gameAction.move

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    MoveBehavior
    Each GodCard that modify the move mechanics has to implement at least one of those methods.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    ApolloMoves
    APOLLO Your Worker may move into an opponent Workerâ€™s space by forcing their Worker to the space yours just vacated.
    ApolloMoveTest
    APOLLO Your Worker may move into an opponent Workerâ€™s space by forcing their Worker to the space yours just vacated.
    ArtemisMoves
    ARTEMIS Your Worker may move one additional time, but not back to its initial space
    ArtemisMoveTest
    ARTEMIS Your Worker may move one additional time, but not back to its initial space
    AthenaMoves
    ATHENA If one of your Workers moved up on your last turn, opponent Workers cannot move up this turn
    AthenaMovesTest
    ATHENA If one of your Workers moved up on your last turn, opponent Workers cannot move up this turn
    MinotaurMoves
    MINOTAUR Your Worker move into an opponent Workerâ€™s space, if their Worker can be forced one space straight backwards to an unoccupied space at any level
    MinotaurMoveTest  
    MoveContext
    Here is where the model can chose what kind of move has to be called.
    PrometheusMove
    PROMETHEUS If your Worker does not move up, it may build both before and after moving.
    PrometheusTest
    PROMETHEUS: If your Worker does not move up, it may build both before and after moving.
    SimpleMoves
    SIMPLE COMPUTE VALID MOVES This method check for normal moves that a token can perform.
    SimplePerformMoveTest
    A token can move in all 8 Cells around himself with the following exceptions: he can not occupy a cell where is another token (regardless if it's his own or not); he can not move up on a height >1 of it's own; he can not move on a dome; he can not move out the battlefield.
    SimpleValidMoveTest
